RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Engenheiro de Aeronсutica pelo Instituto Tecnolѓgico de Aeronсutica (ITA) (1983), Mestre em Engenharia Aeronсutica tambщm pelo ITA (1987), Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering e Ph.D. pelo Georgia Institute of Technology (1992), Especialista em Seguranчa de Aviaчуo pela University of Southern California (USC) (2002) e Master in Business Administration pela parceria ITA-Escola Superior de Propaganda e Marketing, ESPM (2003). Donizeti щ Especialista em Fonщtica do Inglъs Americano pela American English School, Atlanta, 1992. Tem experiъncia em Engenharia de Helicѓpteros e Seguranчa de Aviaчуo. Atualmente щ Professor Colaborador de pѓs-graduaчуo do ITA. Ministrou cursos de Fundamentos de Engenharia Aeronсutica, Aerodinтmica e Desempenho de Helicѓpteros e Aeronaves de Asas Rotativas, Dinтmica e Aeroelastiicidade de Helicѓpteros e Aeronaves de Asas Rotativas, Projeto de Aviѕes, Dinтmica de Estruturas e Aeroelasticidade de Aviѕes, Metodologia do Trabalho Cientэfico, Ambientes de Negѓcios em Aviaчуo. Nos њltimos 16 anos, o Professor Donizeti de Andrade assumiu a lideranчa no desenvolvimento de parcerias e geraчуo de conhecimento em trъs aчѕes estratщgicas na interface aeronсutica-defesa-seguranчa no Brasil: (1) a partir de marчo de 2004: concepчуo, implementaчуo e coordenaчуo das ofertas de cursos acadъmicos na сrea de Seguranчa de Aviaчуo e Aeronavegabilidade Continuada, como professor do ITA (cursos de Especializaчуo e de Mestrado Profissional, PE e MP-Safety); (2) a partir de julho de 2005: criaчуo de uma equipe de profissionais com competъncias complementares, com vistas р geraчуo de um programa completo incluindo engenharia de projeto, engenharia de manufatura, interfaces industriais e rede de serviчos necessсrios para estabelecer uma indњstria brasileira de aeronaves de asas rotativas, chamada BrasCopter, cujo primeiro produto щ o Helicѓptero AlphaOne; e (3) a partir de 17 de setembro de 2012, criaчуo da DDA Soluчѕes Estratщgicas em Educaчуo, Engenharia Aeronсutica e Espacial & Seguranчa de Aviaчуo e Aeronavegabilidade Continuada (DDA SE), empresa de consultoria. Quanto р primeira aчуo, seus resultados sуo as ofertas do Curso de Especializaчуo em Seguranчa de Aviaчуo e Aeronavegabilidade Continuada (PE-Safety), iniciadas em 2004, cujo sucesso levou o ITA a criar o Mestrado Profissional (MP-Safety) na mesma сrea, em dezembro de 2007. Os dois cursos tornaram-se referъncias no Brasil para o preparo acadъmico de engenheiros (de quase todos os matizes ligados р Aviaчуo), pilotos (civis, militares), executivos das mais importantes instituiчѕes ligadas р Aviaчуo, organizaчѕes e empresas ligadas р aviaчуo no Paэs. A segunda aчуo permitiu, em um primeiro momento, o suporte financeiro da Fundaчуo de Amparo р Pesquisa do Estado de Sуo Paulo (FAPESP) por meio dos programas de Pesquisa Inovativa em Pequenas Empresas (PIPEs), seguido do estabelecimento de uma alianчa entre a BrasCopter e o Departamento de Ciъncia e Tecnologia Aeroespacial (DCTA) para trabalhar em parceria com a alianчa entre a Eurocopter (agora Airbus Helicopters) e o ONERA (Office National d?Etudes et de Recherches Aщrospatiales), da Franчa, para executar um programa de contrapartica financeira (offset), financiado pela Airbus Helicopters, destinado a aperfeiчoar o desenvolvimento do Helicѓptero AlphaOne da BrasCopter. O Description of Work (DOW) foi assinado pelas partes em 28 de junho de 2012 e o trabalho conjunto iniciou-se em 1 de dezembro daquele ano. Esta parceria desenvolveu-se atщ setembro de 2017. A terceira aчуo, com a criaчуo da DDA Soluчѕes Estratщgicas, tem o objetivo de ter no Brasil uma empresa de consultoria embasada em visуo sistъmica de modo a colocar-se como um stakeholder efetivo no contexto da Sociedade do Conhecimentos, agregando valor e experiъncias a partir de todos os seus altamente qualificados colaboradores, juntamente com as liчѕes aprendidas que trazem por dщcadas de experiъncia, sob o contexto da Aviaчуo, Aeronсutica, Defesa e Seguranчa.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Graduated Aeronautical Engineer by the Technological Institute of Aeronautics (ITA) in 1983, Master in Aeronautical Engineering also by ITA in 1987, Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering and Doctor of Philosophy both in 1992 by the Georgia Institute of Technology (GATech), Specialist in Aviation Safety by the University of Southern California (USC) in 2002, and Master in Business Administration (MBA) in the partnership ITA and the Escola Superior de Propaganda e Marketing, in 2003. Donizeti is also Specialist in Phonics of the American English by the American English School, Atlanta, 1992. He has experience in Helicopter Engineering. He is Inviting Professor of undergrad and graduate courses in ITA, member of the Permanent Faculty of ITA's Graduate Studies. He was responsible for teaching disciplines of Fundamentals of Aeronautical Engineering, Aerodynamics and Performance of Helicopters and Rotary-Wing Aircraft, Dynamics and Aeroelasticity of Helicopters and Rotary-Wing Aircraft, Airplane Design, Structural Dynamics and Aeroelasticity of Fixed-Wing Aircraft, Methodology of Scientific Work, Aviation Business Environment: a Strategic Perspective. For the last 16 years, Professor Donizeti de Andrade has taken the leadership in the development of partnerships and knowledge generation in three strategic actions in Brazil, in the interface of Aeronautics, Defense and Aviation Safety: (1) from March 204 on: conception, implementation and offering of academic courses in Aviation Safety and Continued Airworthiness, as an ITA professor (courses of Specialization and Professional Master, PE and MP-Safety); (2) from December 2005 on: foundation of a team of professionals with complementary competences, aiming the generation of a complete program involving design engineering, manufacturing engineering, industrial interfaces and services network necessary to create a Brazilian Helicopter and Rotary-Wing Industry, BrasCopter, whose first product is the Helicopter AlphaOne; and (3) from September 17, 2012 on, the launching of DDA Strategic Solutions in Education, Aeronautical and Space Engineering & Aviation Safety and Continued Airworthiness (DDA SE), a consulting company. The first action led to the offers of ITA?s Specialization course in Aviation Safety and Continued Airworthiness (PE-Safety), whose success yielded ITA to create the Professional Master in the same aщrea, in December 2007. The two courses have become references in Brazil for the academic education of engineers (of basically all interfaces with Aviation), pilots (civil, military), executives of the most important institutions, aviations and companies linked to Aviation in Brazil. The second action has allowed, in the first place, the financial fostering of the Sуo Paulo State Research Fostering Foundation (FAPESP), by means of its Innovative Research in Small Companies Program (PIPE), followed by the stablishment of a partnership between BrasCopter and the Brazilian Air Force Department of Aerospace Science and Technology (DCTA) to work with the the partnership between Eurocopter (now Airbus Helicopters) and ONERA (Office National d?Etudes et de Recherches Aщrospatiales), of France, to implemente a programo financial counterpart (?offset?) destined to enhance the development of BrasCopter?s Helicopter AlphaOne, financed by Airbus Helicopters. The Description of Work (DOW), was signed by the parties on June 28, 2012 and the joined work started on December 1, in the same year. This partnership went on till September 2017. The third action, along with the birth of DDA Strategic Solutions came the objective of having a consulting company with systemic vision roots to be an effective stakeholder of the Knowledge Society, adding value and experiences of all the well-qualified collaborators, along with the learned lessons they carry on for decades, under the umbrella of Aviation, Aeronautics, Defense and Safety.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Projeto de Produtividade em Pesquisa visando р(ao): (1) Modelagem aeroelсstica do fenєmeno de "blade sailing" de helicѓpteros, considerando as nуo-linearidades estruturais associadas a grandes oscilaчѕes de batimento das pсs de rotores articulados que podem provocar danos estruturais; (2) Estudo do ambiente operacional tэpico da ocorrъncia do fenєmeno de "blade sailing", que envolve os efeitos de fortes rajadas de vento durante a partida ou parada do rotor---helicѓpteros embarcados sуo particularmente suscetэveis р ocorrъncia de "blade sailing" e, portanto, o trabalho procurou estudar modelos simplificados dos efeitos do vento sobre o convєo ("flight deck") de um navio tэpico, em ambiente marэtimo---; (3) Estudo de modelos de "blade sailing" das Universidades de Southhampton e Pennsylvannia State; (4) Anсlise nуo-linear do modelo aeroelсstico de "blade sailing" obtido, utilizando a abordagem do espaчo de estados e simulaчуo numщrica (mщtodo de Runge-Kutta) para obter diagramas de resposta no domэnio do tempo, espaчo de fases e bifurcaчѕes; e (5) Estudo dos diagramas e dados obtidos da simulaчуo numщrica visando a identificar as fontes de excitaчуo e os principais parтmetros envolvidos na ocorrъncia das vibraчѕes de batimento das pсs que caracterizam o fenєmeno de "blade sailing"---os resultados obtidos servem de base para eventuais modificaчєes no projeto aeroelсstico dos rotores de helicѓpteros embarcados, bem como para introduчуo de dispositivos para reduчуo das vibraчѕes e controle ativo do "blade sailing".

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Roberto Luiz da Cunha Barroso Ramos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: This paper presents a nonlinear analysis of the helicopter rotor response to a periodic gust. The focus of this study is on the flapping degree of freedom behavior subjected to a sinusoidal vertical gust, considering large deflections associated with nonlinearities. The mathematical model for the flapping motion is obtained and the computational simulations associated with a preliminary bifurcation analysis show that some combinations of values of the system parameters, including the collective pitch angle, Lock number, rotational speed, inflow and gust amplitude/frequency, can give rise to large, possibly destructive, flapping oscillations. The observed bifurcation phenomenon is related to the nonlinear coupling among the rotor excitation sources driven by the gust. Possibly this mechanism is related to the rotary-wing aeroelastic phenomenon called ?blade sailing?.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Nonlinear Flapping Oscillations In Helicopter Rotors

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings do 2nd DinCon, Segundo Congresso Temсtico de Aplicaчѕes de Dinтmica e Controle daSociedade Brasileira de Matemсtica Aplicada e Computacional (SBMAC)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abastract: The article deals with a preliminary performance analysis of lift compound helicopters. Basic differences between conventional and lift compound helicopters are presented, and a suitable methodology for adapting additional systems such as wing and auxiliary propulsion is pointed out. The work includes the modeling to predict both hover and forward flight performances for the new configuration. Differences in drag and required power predictions for the models with and without wings are graphically presented, and effects like weight, tip speed and flat plate equivalent area are discussed. The adopted model allows qualitative and quantitative results compatible with makers and flight-test data counterparts. The Mil Mi-6 (NATO code-named the helicopter Hook) helicopter is adopted for the validation of the lift compound helicopter model. Results for the new configuration show little improvement in the flight envelope related to cruise speed, maximum range and productivity of the MD-520N, and advantage is observed from the application of the model to the Eurocopter AS 355 F2.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Novas Contribuiчѕes Tecnolѓgicas do Segmento Eletrєnico para a Operaчуo e Seguranчa da Aviaчуo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: O presente trabalho sumariza recentes inovaчѕes tecnolѓgicas na aviaчуo devidas р eletrєnica. Sуo apresentados temas relativos рs сreas de manutenчуo (Intelligent Maintenance), de controle de trсfego aщreo (WAAS/LAAS, ADS-B), telecomunicaчѕes (VHF Data Link Mode ? 2) e de controle de motores (SEC). O propѓsito deste estudo щ apresentar o cenсrio que motivou o desenvolvimento destas tecnologias e como estas solucionam ou pretendem solucionar os desafios que se defrontam.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: THE EXPERIENCE WITH THE EDUCATION ON FUNDAMENTALS WITHIN THE CONTEXT OF THE AERONAUTICAL ENGINEERING

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Congresso Brasileiro de Ensino de Engenharia
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings, Congresso Brasileiro de Ensino de Engenharia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Taught for more than 300 students with the Professional Master Program in Aeronautical and Mechanical Engineering as part of an ITA-EMBRAER alliance and also as part of specialization courses for more than 700 EMBRAER?s engineers and executives since June 1999, the course of Fundamentals of Aeronautical Engineering transformed itself into a strategic tool for the successful start-up of new professionals in the aerospace industry. This article analyzes the key-factors involved in this process, in special: (1) the smooth coupling of the concepts involving Fluid Mechanics, Strength of Materials and other engineering basics with their Aerodynamics, Structures, Propulsion, Performance, Stability, Control and Aeronautical Conceptual Design fundamentals? counterparts; (2) the dynamics involved within the course, where concepts are passed to the student following the historical context of the technological innovation which are cornerstones for the current state-of-the-art in the sector. This is accomplished through documentaries, movies, analyses of technical articles, complemented by tips on the international aeronautical market and its players.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A STRATEGIC INVESTIMENT FOR OUR NATION: EDUCATION ON HELICOPTER ENGINEERING

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Congresso Brasileiro de Ensino de Engenharia
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings, Congresso Brasileiro de Ensino de Engenharia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Summary: There is no doubt that, regarding the defense industry, the use of helicopters turned into a key-factor for success. This involves military troops transportation and observation roles, and, especially, the helicopter is right now the most important asset to guarantee the effective logistics in the theater of operations in the modern war scene. In civilian applications its applications are even more versatile: they go from the sight seeing so important to the tourism and movie industries, to telecommunications, rescue and recovery in a calamity environment, up to inspections for preserving environmental reserves. ITA has kept a minimum set of courses and a research line in Helicopter Engineering for the last 11 years. The courses aim the formation of the aeronautical engineer and of engineers with a mechanical-like background, and are offered to complement the technical education of both test pilots and test engineers. The substantial growing of the civilian market in the last 10 years, especially in countries like Brazil, demands, at least for the medium term, a continuous and higher investment on education in this field of the aeronautical knowledge, if Brazil indeed decides to acquire a so desired international technological independency. This article analyzes the strategic importance of the education on Helicopter Engineering based on the experience accumulated so far, and points details on how other countries attacked the problem and invested to better their rotorcraft technological knowledge.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: EXPERIENCE IN A STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIP: PROFESSIONAL MASTER?S IN AERONAUTICAL ENGINEERING, ITA-EMBRAER

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Congresso Brasileiro de Ensino de Engenharia
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings, Congresso Brasileiro de Ensino de Engenharia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Summary: Before the several challenges particularly faced by the aeronautical and defense industries these days, the consolidation of strategic partnerships to guaranteeing a solid technical and technological background for the involved human resources constitutes an essential key-factor for the entrepreneurship success. For both ITA and EMBRAER, organizations with a common historical link of pioneering and close cooperation for the last 30 years, the investment towards the creation and implementation of the Professional Master in Aeronautical Engineering Program stands right now as a major asset. With its nearly 300 students registered and with a first class up to concluding the program credit courses, all involved in the development of their final work---all of them applied directly to aircraft projects within EMBRAER?s portfolio of programs---this partnership can already being considered a real success. This article is focused into the main points of the program as for example how the multidisciplinary curriculum phases were tailored, involving a suitable corps of faculty and administrative staff, along with the contribution of professionals from well-recognized international educational and aeronautical industry organizations in order to accomplish the set goals. One believes that such an experience can serve as a model for upcoming strategies envisioning the assurance of lasting competitive differentials for both the aeronautical and the defense industries in Brazil.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: System Identification Techniques Applied to Aircraft Accident Investigation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Society of Air Safety Investigation Seminar
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: ISASI SEMINAR 2005

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Trabalho apresentado no ISASI Seminar 2005. Autores: Nei Salis Brasil, Gustavo Cazzeli, Luiz Carlos Sandoval Gѓes, Helder Moreira Hemerly e Donizeti de Andrade. Segue o sumсrio. This paper deals with aerodynamic parameters identification techniques applied to aircraft accident or incident investigations. The objective of the technique is to identify degradation on aerodynamic characteristics of a possible aircraft in-flight loss of control. This characteristics impairment arises mostly from wing and tail surface contamination. However, the proposed aerodynamic parameters identification technique may also estimate control surfaces power deterioration and inversions. In this approach, the FDR data is analyzed through system identification algorithm that provides the aerodynamic parameter estimates, enabling comparison with aircraft project characteristics. The research resources for this work are provided by both ITA and EMBRAER, which developed the system identification tools and stand on air safety improvement and accident investigation application of this technology. This paper presents some features of aerodynamic parameter estimation techniques and its relationship with aircraft accident analysis. The efficiency of this approach is shown and the main advantages become clear through analysis of a simulated in-flight icing event.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Citaчуo RAMOS, Roberto Luiz da Cunha Barroso ; de Andrade, D. ; Gѓes, L. C. S. . Individual Blade Root Control of Helicopter Blade Sailing for Articulated Shipboard Rotors. In: American Helicopter Society 65th Annual Forum, 2009, Grapevine, TX, May 25-27, 2009.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract This paper investigates an individual-blade-root-control approach to the reduction of helicopter blade sailing and suppression of tunnel strikes for articulated rotors, considering steady flow conditions during engagement shipboard operations. The aeroservoelastic modeling includes a nonlinear structural dynamics related to the droop and flap stops, a linear aerodynamic model based on the blade-element theory, a linear gust model for the ship airwake, and a lift compensator. The blade-sailing model is a forced parametric flapping oscillator with nonlinear stiffness and time-varying coefficients. The aeroelastic control law design yields a flap-state-feedback individual-blade-root controller for the lift/angle-of-attack compensation whose parameters are associated with the damping/stiffness enhancement of the flapping oscillator. The simulation results show that the proposed active aeroelastic controller yields blade-sailing reduction of nearly 30% in upward and downward deflections at severe wind-over-deck conditions by using low blade pitch input limits of the actuators. This blade-sailing reduction can prevent tunnel strikes from occurring. The relaxation of the actuator limits can significantly improve the attenuation of the blade deflections.

Aeroservoelastic Analysis of a Proposed Helicopter Blade-Sailing Feedback Control System in Unsteady Flow. In: 8th Brazilian Conference on Dynamics, Control and Applications, 2009, Bauru, SP.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: This paper analyzes the response of a helicopter blade-sailing control system in the presence of unsteady flow effects. The aeroservoelastic analysis focuses on the performance of a proposed individual-blade-root controller with respect to the reduction of blade flapping vibrations in articulated rotors during engagement shipboard operations. The designed flap-state-feedback control law yields active lift compensation by increasing the damping/stiffness of the flapping motion. The simulation results show that the proposed aeroelastic controller can yield tunnel-strike suppression and significant reduction in upward blade tip deflections at the unsteady wind-over-deck conditions of interest without actuator saturation.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract ? This paper investigates an individual-blade-root-control approach to the reduction of helicopter blade sailing in hingeless rotors, considering steady flow conditions during engagement shipboard operations and using theoretical aeroservoelasticity principles. The aeroelastic control law synthesis yields a flap-state-feedback individual-blade-root controller for the lift/angle-of-attack compensation whose parameters are associated with the damping/stiffness enhancement of the flapping motion. The simulation results show that the proposed aeroservoelastic controller can obtain blade-sailing reduction of nearly 30% in upward and downward deflections at severe wind-over-deck conditions by using low blade pitch input limits of the actuators. This blade-sailing reduction can prevent tunnel/tail-boom strikes from occurring.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Citacao RAMOS, Roberto Luiz da Cunha Barroso; de Andrade, D. ; Gѓes, L. C. S. Damping Enhancement of a Proposed Helicopter Blade-Sailing Aeroservoelastic System Using Individual Blade Root Control. 20o International Congress of Mechanical Engineering, 2009, Gramado, RS
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract. This paper analyzes the response of a proposed helicopter blade-sailing aeroservoelastic system with active damping enhancement based on individual blade root control. The designed flap-rate-feedback controller, in the rotating frame, yields active lift compensation through a blade pitch angle variation at the blade root, increasing the damping of the flapping motion without rotor design changes. The objective is the reduction of flapping deflections and the suppression of tunnel strikes for articulated rotors, considering steady-flow conditions during engagement shipboard operations. The aeroservoelastic modeling includes a nonlinear structural dynamics related to the droop and flap stops, blade-element aerodynamics with reverse-flow effects, a linear gust model for the ship airwake, gravity effects and an active lift compensator based on individual blade root control with actuator constraints. The aeroservoelastic analysis and design focus on the performance of the proposed individual-blade-root controller with respect to the reduction of blade flapping vibrations in high wind conditions. The closed-loop blade-sailing dynamics constitutes a pitch-controlled flapping oscillator with nonlinear stiffness and time-varying coefficients and it is simulated for an articulated rotor whose properties are based on the H-46 shipboard rotor. The simulation results show that the damping enhancement of the proposed aeroservoelastic system yields tunnel-strike suppression and it is associated with blade-sailing reduction of nearly 35% in upward deflections and nearly 20% in downward deflections at severe steady-flow wind-over-deck conditions, by using blade root-actuator limits of Б 6o

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Citacao RAMOS, Roberto Luiz da Cunha Barroso; de Andrade, D.; Gѓes, L. C. S. PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS OF A HELICOPTER BLADE-SAILING AEROSERVOELASTIC SYSTEM WITH INDIVIDUAL BLADE ROOT CONTROL AND REVERSE-FLOW EFFECTS. 11th Pan-American Congress of Applied Mechanics, January 4-8, Foz do Iguaчu, PR.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract. This paper analyzes the vibration-reduction performance of a proposed blade-sailing aeroservoelastic system with individual blade root control (IBRC), including aerodynamic reverse-flow effects. IBRC-based actuation, in the rotating frame, allows the compensation of aerodynamic forces by superimposing a blade pitch angle variation at the blade root to the collective/cyclic commands. The objective is the reduction of flapping deflections and the suppression of tunnel strikes for articulated rotors, considering steady-flow conditions during engagement shipboard operations. The aeroservoelastic modeling includes a nonlinear structural dynamics related to the droop/flap stops, blade-element aerodynamics with reverse-flow effects, a linear gust model for the ship airwake, gravity effects and an active lift compensator. The performance analysis considers a proportional-integral-derivative (PID) individual-blade-root controller with actuator constraints for the lift/angle-of-attack compensation associated with the stiffness and damping enhancement of the flapping oscillator. The closed-loop blade-sailing dynamics constitutes a forced parametric oscillator with nonlinear stiffness and time-varying coefficients and it is simulated for an articulated rotor whose properties are based on the H-46 shipboard rotor. The PID control parameters are varied in order to analyze the effects of the closed-loop stiffness and damping on the alleviation of flapping vibrations. The simulation results show that the proposed PID-IBRC aeroservoelastic system yields tunnel-strike suppression and it is associated with blade-sailing reduction of nearly 50% in upward deflections and nearly 35% in downward deflections for an incoming wind velocity of 45 kt, by using blade-root-actuator limits of Б 6 deg.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: A company may operate a helicopter?s fleet for years with many potential unsafe conditions without adverse consequence. Without effective safety management to identify and correct these unsafe conditions, the company may assume that it is meeting its safety objectives, as evident by the ?absence of losses?. In reality, it has been lucky! Starting from this idea, present in the ICAO Safety Management Manual, a systems engineering approach tool was created. It is known that when bad decisions are made, it is not often a problem with the analysis tool in itself, but more often the use of the results. Of course, that does not exclude the case when the analysis tool is the wrong one for the task at hand. And, more often, if the initial considerations are incomplete, misleading or even wrong, then the problem is not with the analysis tool in itself, but with the results it gives. This common situation is due to the fact that professionals involved with project development tend to forget that everything should start from the beginning. In project development, the beginning is the variable assessment for requirements development. Even more, project development is part of systems engineering and should consider, from the start, every multidisciplinary variable which exists, and can be predicted, throughout the entire system life-cycle. A new system engineering method for operations variable assessment is presented: the 7M. The 7M method is a new approach using a systemic method to evaluate the variables involved in a transportation engineering operation problem, using, per example, helicopters. Every kind of variable, from a global to a local point of view, is contemplated and can and should be considered. As so, not only engineering, but also legal, economical, political, security, safety and human factors, among other related variables are used in the method. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: This article shows that a challenging far-sea petroleum offshore exploration operation, for which a robust, reliable and complete set of logistics organization for people helicopter?s transportation, from and to the ?theatre of operations? is necessary, is highly constrained by a complex range of local and time factors. Within these factors one finds not only technical variables linked to the transportation equipment, in this case the helicopter; but also variables associated with the legislation, local, state, federal, and international; the air control; safety and security; SAR; certification, of equipment, companies, aircraft, pilots, engineers, and technicians; technical and academic studies; contracts and financing, of banks, royalties or special participations; industry and market; culture; language; environmental management; support and transport infra-structures; just to mention some. Even from the scarce available information linked to the future Petrobrсs personnel helicopter?s transportation situation, one can easily conclude that new solutions must be created. In terms of the forecast involving the exploration of the Tupi area (so called Prщ-Sal) it is evident that new systems engineering solutions need to be considered and implemented, in a way that the wanted and accepted high levels of logistics, safety and economic effectiveness can be reached. In summary, it is paramount that operations such as these need to be thought, studied and implemented by technically, managerially and intellectually prepared professionals, effectively and within the correct timing, with the partnership of institutions imbued with one focused strategy. In short, system engineering needs to be consider if a multidisciplinary development process, considering all variables involved is to be provided. The aim of this work is to show that strategic decisions ought to come from decision-makers pursuing one single goal: the adequate and economically viable helicopter?s ope

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract This article shows a new method for operations variable assessment, the 7M. The aim is to present new approach using a systemic method to evaluate the variables involved in a transportation engineering operation problem. Every kind of variables, from a global to a local point of view, are contemplated and can and should be considered. As so, not only engineering, but also legal, economical, political, security, safety and human factors, among others, related variables are used in the method. The method is applied to the case of offshore personal transportation on the Prщ-Sal operation. Within these variables, for this case, one finds not only technical variables linked to the transportation modals (i.e., aircrafts, ships, mainly), but also variables associated with the legislation, local, state, federal, and international; the air control; safety and security; SAR; certification of equipment, companies, aircraft, pilots, engineers, and trainees; technical and academic studies; contracts and financing, of banks, royalties or special participations; industry and market; culture; language; environmental management; support and transport infra-structures; just to mention some. From the available information linked to the current Petrobrсs personnel transportation situation, and considering its time-history evolution, one concludes that the solutions presented and used up to now are not the best ones. In terms of the forecast involving the exploration of the Tupi area (so called Prщ-Sal) it is evident that new solutions need to be considered and implemented, in a way that the wanted and accepted high levels of logistics, safety and economical effectiveness can be reached. In summary, it is paramount that operations such as these need to be thought, studied and implemented by technically, managerially and intellectually prepared professionals, effectively and within the correct timing, with the partnership of institutions imbued with one focused strategy. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract - This paper describes a software tool to help the investigation of Runway Overruns. A Trajectory Reconstruction model based on FDR (Flight Data Recorder) data is recorded. The aircraft trajectory on the final approach segment is reconstructed based on parameters recorded on this device. The involved parameters, the calculations and the method's anticipated shortcomings are discussed.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo. Os HUMS (Health and Usage Monitoring Systems) nasceram na atividade offshore, sendo um dos tipos de sistemas de monitoramento de condiчуo - HMS que tambщm consideram parтmetros de emprego dos helicѓpteros. Alinhados р filosofia da manutenчуo preditiva, suas aчѕes propѕem garantir a aeronavegabilidade continuada e reduzir custos operacionais pelo diagnѓstico antecipado e prognѓstico de falhas, principalmente por meio de sensores de vibraчуo, cujos dados sуo tratados por algoritmos dedicados a funчѕes cada vez mais expandidas e integradas a outros subsistemas. Este artigo objetiva apresentar, como um painel prсtico, um breve sumсrio qualitativo desses sistemas, segmentado em: histѓrico e evoluчуo do mercado; arquitetura; benefэcios, desvantagens, limitaчѕes; desafios da certificaчуo; e perspectivas de aplicaчуo.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Presented at the 38th European Rotorcraft Forum, Sept 4-7, 2012
Section: Airworthiness or Operational Aspects & Safety
Brazilian executive transportation has grown significantly facing the challenge of avoiding the traffic jam of great cities and lack of satisfactory airport infrastructure. There is a travel range which is too far for helicopters and too close for fixed-wing aircrafts, where the tiltrotor-type solution, that now enters in the civilian market, may bring better relation between time and cost to the user. The objective of this study is to examine the tiltrotor?s feasibility and its worthiness against other available market options for executive transportation between Brazilian great cities. Tiltrotors are supposed to use the large helicopter landing sites, sometimes far from cities airports. Therefore, the IFR (Instrument Flight Rules) operation is a concern because of the transition to the VFR (Visual Flight Rules) and the following flight to the landing site that, if performed at low speed, the specific fuel consumption would rise because the engines would not be completely tilted forward. Today, the tiltrotor speed would be limited to 80 knots inside some helicopters visual corridors of these cities. The tiltrotor would flight more economically in the fixed-wing corridors, unless the rules for the helicopter corridors are adapted to it. That?s why the certification and safety issues are analyzed. The ANAC (Brazilian Civil Aviation Agency, under the Civil Aviation Secretariat a species of Ministry directly attached to Brazil Presidency) is set to play a major role in definition of the requirements to certify a tiltrotor because, rigorously, it does not fit in any of the present standards. Meanwhile, DECEA (Brazilian Airspace Control Department, under the Air Command which is linked directly to the Defense Ministry) is expected to define the minima for IFR and the rules to use the visual corridors. A typical simulation of a fly departing from Sу

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-3: Prediction of the Horizontal Airspeed Component

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administraчуo pњblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Presented at the 37th European Rotorcraft Forum
Milуo, Sept 3-6, 2011
Abstract The determination of the horizontal air velocity component in low airspeed regime, typically below 40 KIAS, has been a challenge for the rotary-wing engineering development. Regarding this issue, this paper develops a mathematical model, in neural network, for predicting the horizontal air velocity component of the AS 355 F2 helicopter by taking advantage of MatlabЎ Neural Network Toolbox, to be used as a real time telemetry tool by Brazilian Institute of Research and Flight Tests, IPEV. By using a flight test acquisition system installed in the AS 355 F2 tail number FAB 8816, some parameters are measured in the fuselage, like stick positions, rotating speeds and attitudes, during steady-state conditions and leveled flight acceleration maneuvers. These measurements are used as input and references to backpropagation neural networks with supervised learning. Two sort of neural networks are developed: one to predict longitudinal air velocity, u, and other to predict the lateral air velocity, v. Training process approach consists of trying and error by changing input parameters set and neural network structure. The Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm is used to perform the optimization process of networks weights and biases. During the validation procedure a new data set is applied to the neural networks that had provided the best training results for each air velocity. It?s verified that one longitudinal and lateral neural network association, with 11 input parameters and 2 hidden layers with 25 processing elements each, provides satisfactory results in predicting horizontal air velocity component in stabilized maneuvers, with accuracy level of Б3,4 kt and Б16А, along with unsatisfactory results in level flight acceleration maneuvers. Additionally, as a contribution of this work, this neural network association is implemented, by using MatlabЎ, in the Brazilian Air Command IPEV telemetry f

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Presented at the 68th European Rotorcraft Forum
Date: May 2, 2012
Abstract One of the problems facing the Aerospace, Aeronautical, and Defence Industry is the lack, in terms of quantity and quality, of qualified Rotorcraft and System engineers. As Stephen Welby has pointed out, in an AHSI meeting, in the next years there will be a shortage of qualified engineers. One aims to present a System Engineering process to evaluate what should be looked for, in terms of education, to guaranty future qualified, mainly qualitatively but also quantitatively, rotorcraft and system engineers professionals for the industry necessities. Starting from the definition of System, based in System Philosophy, and using System Thinking, one presents the Human System, the Engineer System, and relates it to the professional engineer characteristics looked for by the industry, and the characteristics engineering education curriculum is based on. One concludes that a new paradigm for education must be considered in the engineering academic curriculum.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Presented at the 68th Annual Forum of the American Helicopter Society (AHS)
Date: May 3, 2012
Abstract Aeronautical products, like rotorcrafts, must be designed and developed, and also operated, in accordance with a life cycle approach, understood as a systematic approach not only of the technological product ?from the cradle to the grave? but of the service, which includes the technological product, the social-technical organization, and the evolving environment, and considers history, resources, change and impacts, and provides information gathering, innovation and personnel training and development, so as to identify actual and future (critical) problems and reduce their impact efficiently. One, using System Thinking, and based in System Engineering, Service Engineering and Life Cycle Theories, aims to present a Service System Life Cycle approach to design. One concludes that this new perspective allows for a better design and a new paradigm for the Aerospace, Aeronautical and Defence industries.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administraчуo pњblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Citacao RAMOS, Roberto Luiz da Cunha Barroso; Andrade, D.; Gѓes, L. C. S. . Controle Aeroservoelсstico Individual por Pс do Fenєmeno de Blade Sailing para Helicѓpteros Embarcados Hingeless. Pesquisa Naval (SDM), 2008.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Resumo ? Este artigo investiga uma abordagem de controle individual por pс para reduчуo de blade sailing em rotores de helicѓpteros do tipo hingeless, considerando condiчѕes de escoamento permanente durante operaчѕes embarcadas de partida do rotor e usando princэpios de aeroservoelasticidade teѓrica. A sэntese da lei de controle aeroelсstico resulta em um controlador individual por pс baseado em retroaчуo do estado de batimento (flapping) para a compensaчуo da sustentaчуo/тngulo-de-ataque, cujos parтmetros estуo associados com o aumento do amortecimento/rigidez do movimento de batimento. Os resultados da simulaчуo mostram que o controlador aeroservoelсstico proposto pode obter reduчуo de aproximadamente 30% nas deflexѕes ascendentes e descendentes de blade sailing em condiчѕes severas de vento sobre o convщs de vєo do navio, considerando os limites dos atuadores. Esta reduчуo de blade sailing evita a ocorrъncia de impactos das pсs na fuselagem (tunnel/tail-boom strikes).

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administraчуo pњblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: Os HUMS (Health and Usage Monitoring Systems) nasceram na atividade offshore, sendo um dos tipos de sistemas de monitoramento de condiчуo - HMS que tambщm consideram parтmetros de emprego dos helicѓpteros. Alinhados р filosofia da manutenчуo preditiva, suas aчѕes propѕem garantir a aeronavegabilidade continuada e reduzir custos operacionais pelo diagnѓstico antecipado e prognѓstico de falhas, principalmente por meio de sensores de vibraчуo, cujos dados sуo tratados por algoritmos dedicados a funчѕes cada vez mais expandidas e integradas a outros subsistemas. Este artigo objetiva apresentar, como um painel prсtico, um breve sumсrio qualitativo desses sistemas, segmentado em: histѓrico e evoluчуo do mercado; arquitetura; benefэcios, desvantagens, limitaчѕes; desafios da certificaчуo; e perspectivas de aplicaчуo.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: The HUMS (Health and Usage Monitoring Systems) originated in the offshore activity, and is one of the types of health monitoring systems (HMS) which also consider helicopters utilization parameters. Aligned with the philosophy of predictive maintenance, their actions aim to ensure the continued airworthiness and reduce operating costs through an early diagnosis and prognosis of failures, mainly by means of vibration sensors, whose data are processed by algorithms dedicated to functions increasingly expanded and integrated into other subsystems. This article presents, as a practical panel, a brief qualitative summary of these systems, segmented into: history and evolution of the market, architecture, benefits, disadvantages, limitations, challenges of certification, and application perspectives.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract This work applies the frequency response methodology to characterize and analyze the flying qualities of longitudinal and lateral axes of a rotary-wing aircraft, AS355-F2. Using the results, it?s possible to check the suitability of the aircraft in accordance with ADS-33E-PRF standard, whose flying qualities specifications criteria are based on parameters in the frequency domain. The key steps addressed in the work involves getting, by mean of flight test data, the closed-loop dynamic responses including the design of the instrumentation and specification of the sensors to be used in the flight test campaign, the definition of the appropriate maneuvers characteristics for excitation of the aircraft, the planning and execution of the flight test to collect the data, and the proper data treatment, processing and analysis, after the flight. After treatment of the collected data, single input - single output (SISO) spectral analysis is performed. The results permit the analysis of the flying qualities characteristics, anticipation of the demands that the pilot will be subject to during closed-loop evaluations and check of compliance with the aforementioned standard, within the range of consistent excitation frequencies for flight tests, setting the agility level of the test aircraft.This work describes the key aspects of the management process to apply the frequency response methodology in order to characterize the longitudinal and lateral dynamics of a rotary-wing aircraft and to analyze its flying qualities. With this methodology it is possible to check the suitability of the aircraft in accordance with ADS-33E-PRF standard, whose flying qualities specifications criteria are based on parameters in the frequency-domain. The key steps addressed in the paper involve getting, by means of flight test data, closed-loop dynamic responses for the aircraft including: a) the design of instrumentation and specification of the sensors to be used in the flight test campa

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: STPA for continuous controls: A flight testing study of aircraft crosswind takeoffs
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: STPA for continuous controls: A flight testing study of aircraft crosswind takeoffs

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administraчуo pњblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract A light aircraft crosswind takeoff is a risky operation. The purpose of this paper is to demonstrate the feasibility of applying STPA (Systems-Theoretic Process Analysis) to closed-loop continuous controls, identifying the hazards of crosswind takeoffs with light aircraft and the mitigating actions that could make its execution safer. The paper analyzes the variables that affect the response of the aircraft when subjected to severe crosswind, considering how aircraft characteristics affect its stability. The hazard analysis technique STPA is a tool based on the conceptual accident causality model called STAMP (System-Theoretic Accident Model and Processes), which in turn is based on systems theory. To deal with closed-loop actions on continuous control systems, a new approach to STPA was developed and effectively used to analyze data collected on a crosswind flight test campaign. This campaign, conducted by the Flight Test and Research Institute, led to a flight envelope extension of the Embraer?s training aircraft Super Tucano. The demonstration analysis showed the need for new, previously unidentified mitigating measures to be assigned to aircraft manufacturers, operators or owners, and their pilots.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract A light aircraft crosswind takeoff is a risky operation. The paper analyzes the variables that affect the response of the aircraft when subjected to severe crosswind, considering how aircraft characteristics affect its stability. The hazard analysis technique STPA is a tool based on the conceptual accident causality model called STAMP (System-Theoretic Accident Model and Processes), which in turn is based on systems theory. To deal with closed-loop actions on continuous control systems, a new approach to STPA was developed and effectively used to analyze data collected on a crosswind flight test campaign. DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Individual Blade Root Control of Helicopter Blade Sailing for Articulated Shipboard Rotors

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 65th Annual Forum of the American Helicopter Society

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Roberto Luiz da Cunha Barroso Ramos

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Seguranчa de Aviaчуo e Aeronavegabilidade Continuada

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administraчуo pњblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract This paper investigates an individual-blade-root-control approach to the reduction of helicopter blade sailing and suppression of tunnel strikes for articulated rotors, considering steady flow conditions during engagement shipboard operations. The aeroservoelastic modeling includes a nonlinear structural dynamics related to the droop and flap stops, a linear aerodynamic model based on the blade-element theory, a linear gust model for the ship airwake, and a lift compensator. The blade-sailing model is a forced parametric flapping oscillator with nonlinear stiffness and time-varying coefficients. The aeroelastic control law design yields a flap-state-feedback individual-blade-root controller for the lift/angle-of-attack compensation whose parameters are associated with the damping/stiffness enhancement of the flapping oscillator. The simulation results show that the proposed active aeroelastic controller yields blade-sailing reduction of nearly 30% in upward and downward deflections at severe wind-over-deck conditions by using low blade pitch input limits of the actuators. This blade-sailing reduction can prevent tunnel strikes from occurring. The relaxation of the actuator limits can significantly improve the attenuation of the blade deflections.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The involvement of the human beings with Engineering in practical terms comes from very old times. Formally speaking, it came of age with the creation of Щcole Polytechnique, in Paris, 1793. Aviation has showed off in the last decades of the 19th Century and first years of the 20th Century, with the pioneers? flights. Aeronautical Engineering started with the Germans also along the first years of the 20th Century. What do these areas have in common? How are they connected? Where are we by now in theses sectors, and what comes next?

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Durante o primeiro ano do projeto PIPE associado a esse relatѓrio (2015), a BrasCopter ampliou seus contatos e diversas parcerias foram estabelecidas e outras fortalecidas. Em sэntese, as mesmas podem ser segmentadas em; (1) de Projeto; (2) Financeiras; (3) de Manufatura; (4) de Negѓcios. Alщm disso, em termos de parcerias, reuniѕes visando a iniciar o processo de Certificaчуo (Civil e Militar) do Helicѓptero AlphaOne foram realizadas. Tambщm, alщm do contato direto com o ITA e seus alunos, a BrasCopter, por meio da parceria com a EFAI - Escola de Pilotagem, fechou acordo com a FATEC de Sуo Josщ dos Campos. Esses envolvimentos sуo resumidos nesse relatѓrio.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: During the first year of the PIPE project associated to this report (2015), BrasCopter enlarged its contacts and establishing new partnerships and strengthening others. In synthesis, they can be segmented in: (1) Project; (2) Finances; (3) Manufacturing; (4) Business. Besides that, in terms of partnerships, meetings were held towards the certification process (civil and military) for the AlphaOne Helicopter. Furthermore, beyond the close contact with ITA students, BrasCopter, by means of the partnership with EFAI - Piloting School, closed an agreement with FATEC Sуo Josщ dos Campos. These involvements are summarized in this report.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administraчуo pњblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Projeto de Produtividade em Pesquisa visando р(ao): (1) Modelagem aeroelсstica do fenєmeno de ?blade sailing? de helicѓpteros, considerando as nуo-linearidades estruturais associadas a grandes oscilaчѕes de batimento das pсs de rotores articulados que podem provocar danos estruturais; (2) Estudo do ambiente operacional tэpico da ocorrъncia do fenєmeno de ?blade sailing?, que envolve os efeitos de fortes rajadas de vento durante a partida ou parada do rotor---helicѓpteros embarcados sуo particularmente suscetэveis р ocorrъncia de ?blade sailing? e, portanto, o trabalho procurou estudar modelos simplificados dos efeitos do vento sobre o convєo (?flight deck?) de um navio tэpico, em ambiente marэtimo---; (3) Estudo de modelos de ?blade sailing? das Universidades de Southhampton e Pennsylvania State; (4) Anсlise nуo-linear do modelo aeroelсstico de ?blade sailing? obtido, utilizando a abordagem do espaчo de estados e simulaчуo numщrica (mщtodo de Runge-Kutta) para obter diagramas de resposta no domэnio do tempo, espaчo de fases e bifurcaчѕes; e (5) Estudo dos diagramas e dados obtidos da simulaчуo numщrica visando a identificar as fontes de excitaчуo e os principais parтmetros envolvidos na ocorrъncia das vibraчѕes de batimento das pсs que caracterizam o fenєmeno de ?blade sailing?---os resultados obtidos servem de base para eventuais modificaчѕes no projeto aeroelсstico dos rotores de helicѓpteros embarcados, bem como para introduчуo de dispositivos para reduчуo das vibraчѕes e controle ativo do ?blade sailing?. Pesquisa desenvolvida durante o perэodo de tese de Doutorado do Mestre Roberto Luiz da Cunha Barroso Ramos, no ITA, de 2003 a 2007.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Productivity Research Project aiming: (1) aeroelastic modeling of the blade sailing phenomenon in helicopters, taking into account structural nonlinearities associated to large blade flapping oscillations in articulated helicopter rotors which may induce structural damages; (2) Study of the operational environment typical to the blade sailing phenomenon, involving strong wind gusts during the start or stopping of the helicopter rotor -- embarked helicopters are particular susceptible to the blade sailing occurrence, and, then, the work intends to investigate simplified models of the wind effects over the flight over the deck, in a typical ship, in maritime environment --; (3) Study of blade sailing models developed by the University of Southhampton and Penn State; (4) Nonlinear analysis of the blade sailing aeroelastic model obtained, utilizing a state-space approach in the time domain, phase space and bifurcations; and (5) Study of the diagrams and data obtained by the numerical simulations with the purpose of identifying the excitation sources and the main parameters within the blade flapping vibrations which characterize the blade sailing phenomenon -- the obtained results work as basis for probable modifications in the aeroelastic projects of embarked helicopter rotors, as well for introduction of tools to the reduction of vibrations and active control of blade sailing. This research was developed during the thesis work of Roberto Luiz da Cunha Barroso Ramos, M.Sc., in ITA, in the period of 2003-2007.

Dissertaчуo defendida em dezembro de 2007 e concluэda e aprovada em maio de 2008. Banca examinadora: Prof. Donizeti de Andrade Chairperson/Advisor - ITA Eng. M.C. Guilherme Conceiчуo Rocha Co-Advisor - EMBRAER Prof. Luis Gonzaga Trabasso - ITA Prof. Lэgia Maria Soto Urbina - ITA Eng. M.E.Gustavo Martins Rios - EMBRAER
Abstract Flight Safety is nowadays one of the concerns of global aviation community and is relevant to the survival of the aeronautical industry. In this context, expansion of Human Factors awareness presents a significant opportunity to make aviation safer, since the human / machine interface is a frequent source of error. This work analyzes the human interface with a specific aircraft system, i. e., the Gust Lock System of ERJ-145. The aim is to define a framework for developing a human error assessment process to mitigate the effects of human error, in the same way the system safety process mitigates the effects of system possible failures. From the system safety engineering standpoint, the human can be taken as part of the considered system. Then, functions that the human needs to perform in his interaction with the system can be identified. With this information, each human failure mode can be assessed critically and the human related failure effects along the system can be studied. This study can result in design changes or improvements that may minimize the effects of unacceptable human failure modes. Furthermore, it is discussed some points of the Safety Assessment conducted by EMBRAER, in order to identify possible deficiencies in the development of safety cases using classical safety analysis techniques as well as make suggestions for the enhancement of these techniques. According to this approach, an analysis of the calculation of the average probability per flight hour is conducted when there are latent events along the process. Besides, it is performed the sensitivity analysis of a component failure so as to identify technical b

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Orientador: Donizeti de Andrade Co-Orientador: Paulo Soares Oliveira Filho
Resumo Este estudo tem por objetivo o desenvolvimento de uma ferramenta para o cсlculo da trajetѓria de uma aeronave que tenha se envolvido em um incidente de excursуo de pista. A ferramenta realiza seus cсlculos a partir dos dados de voo do FDR (Flight Data Recorder). O resultado do trabalho щ uma ferramenta њtil para a investigaчуo deste tipo de ocorrъncia, pois a mesma pode auxiliar na identi caчуo dos fatores contribuintes envolvidos. Os requisitos para a ferramenta sуo defi nidos e o seu desenvolvimento segue tais requisitos. Existem vсrias maneiras de calcular a trajetѓria a partir dos dados do FDR. Neste trabalho, trъs mщtodos de reconstituiчуo sуo descritos e um deles щ escolhido para ser implementado na ferramenta. Parтametros gravados no FDR sуo utilizados para criar uma reconstituiчуo da posiчуo da aeronave desde a aproximaчуo final atщ seu ponto de toque na superfэcie da pista. Por fim, os resultados obtidos pela ferramenta sуo validados por uma dada metodologia e como conclusуo, щ feita uma discussуo sobre se os requisitos propostos sуo efetivamente atingidos.
Banca Prof. Dr. Donizeti de Andrade Advisor - ITA Prof. Dr. Pedro Paglione Associate Professor - ITA Eng. Paulo Soares Oliveira Filho Co-advisor - EMBRAER Dr. Celso Braga de Mendon ca External Member - EMBRAER
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract This study describes the development of a tool for the computation of the aircraft trajectory when it gets involved in a runway overrun incident. This tool performs its com- putations based on the FDR (Flight Data Recorder) in-flight data. The result of this study is a useful tool for the investigation of such events because it may help in the identi ca- tion of the involved contributing factors. The requirements for the tool are de ned and the tool development follows the proposed requirements. There are several ways to calculate the trajectory based on the FDR data. In this study, three reconstruction methods are described and one of these methods is implemented in the tool. Several FDR parameters are used to create a reconstitution of aircraft's position from the nal approach to the touchdown point on the runway surface. Finally, the tool's results are validated based on a proposed methodology and the conclusion discusses whether the tool's requirements are e ectively achieved.

Orientador: Prof. Dr. Donizeti de Andrade Co-Orientador: CF (RM1) Fernando Moraes Ribeiro
Resumo Dentre todas as ferramentas utilizadas para prevenчуo de acidentes aeronсuticos, as vistorias e auditorias de seguranчa estуo entre as mais importantes e eficazes. Sua principal finalidade щ a identificaчуo prѓativa de situaчѕes e condiчѕes com potencial de provocar danos materiais, lesѕes corporais ou morte, contribuindo para a preservaчуo de material de alto custo e de vidas humanas. A nэvel mundial, estudos tъm sido realizados com o intuito de desenvolver novos sistemas e ferramentas de prevenчуo de acidentes capazes de detectar falhas latentes geradas nos mais altos nэveis de uma organizaчуo, antes que tais falhas gerem situaчѕes de risco, ao combinarem-se com o erro humano. A deteчуo dessas falhas, a nэvel organizacional, envolve a necessidade de conhecimento da cultura de uma organizaчуo e da percepчуo de seus membros em relaчуo р seguranчa. Os эndices de ocorrъncias aeronсuticas na MB nуo vъm apresentando melhorias, estando praticamente estagnados ao longo dos њltimos dez anos. Tal estagnaчуo, aliada р percepчуo do ѓrgуo central de seguranчa de aviaчуo da Marinha e р opiniуo coletiva dos oficiais responsсaveis pela seguranчa de aviaчуo nas unidades aщreas evidenciam necessidades de evoluчуo e mudanчa nos mщtodos e processos de prevenчуo de acidentes empregados pela MB. Dentro desse contexto, a Vistoria de Seguranчa de Aviaчуo foi identificada como a ferramenta de prevenчуo que carece de maiores mudanчas em sua abordagem. Portanto, este trabalho tem como objetivo propor mudanчas na atual metodologia da VSA, a qual nуo aborda aspectos culturais e organizacionais, limitando-se a uma abordagem voltada para o cumprimento de mэnimos padrѕes regulamentares, fato que pode estar contribuindo para que o эndice de participaчуo de fatores ligados ao erro humano nas ocorrъncias aeronсuticas da Aviaчуo Naval se mantenha num patamar inaceitсvel. Este trabalho, atravщs de um
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract Among all tools used to prevent mishaps, the audits and inspections are one of the most e ective and important. It`s main goal is to identify, in a proactive manner, poten- tial conditions and situations which might produce damage, wounds or deaths, contributing to preserve human life and high cost hardware. Worldwide, studies have been done in a attempt to develop new systems and safety tools in such a way they become able to detect latent failures originated at the top level of an organization, before such failures combine with human active errors, leading to risky situations. The detection of these failures, at organizational level, involve the understanding of the organizational culture and how peo- ple perceive safety in the organization. The mishap rates in Brazilian Navy have not been reduced. It is practically stagnated over the past ten years. Such stagnation, in conjunc- tion with the Brazilian Navy aviation safety agency perceptions plus the collective opinion of o cers responsible for safety in the air units, make clear the need for changes in the accident prevention methods and processes employed by Brazilian Navy. In this context, the current aviation safety inspection is the safety tool which needs the biggest approach changes. For this reason, this work suggests changes in the current methodology, which not covers cultural and organizational aspects, concentrating it`s e orts entirely on com- pliance based approaches, what might be contributing to the maintenance of the human factors related events numbers at an unacceptable level. This work, employing an organi- zational approach, o ers new tools to assess the organizational culture and safety climate as well as changes in how the human resources would be prepared to conduct the audits. The Operational Safety Audit comes as the main element of an integrated accident pre- vention tool solution, which development goes through the review of the most important initiatives

Orientador: Donizeti de Andrade Co-Orientador: Paulo Soares Oliveira Filho
Resumo
O lanчamento mundial dos VLJ (Jatos Muito Leves) щ um desafio em termos de seguranчa de vєo e investigaчуo. Pretende-se que os VLJs sejam pilotados por apenas um piloto e tenham um grau elevado de automaчуo, com os mais avanчados cockpits e grande uso de software embarcado. Apesar de que em alguns casos nуo щ obrigatѓrio que eles tenham CVR/FDR, alguns fabricantes optaram por incluir esses gravadores nos seus VLJs, visando a aumentar sua seguranчa e a capacidade de investigaчуo. Os FDRs serуo mais limitados do que os utilizados na aviaчуo comercial, mas, mesmo assim, possibilitarуo a participaчуo em vсrios programas de monitoramento da seguranчa, como FOQA. Esse estudo descreve os VLJs e sistemas de gravaчуo atuais, cobre a seleчуo de parтmetros para os gravadores de dados de um VLJ e propѕe a estrutura de um programa de FOQA para esse tipo de aeronave. A aeronave utilizada como estudo de caso щ o Phenom 100, da EMBRAER.
Data da Defesa: 11 de agosto de 2009
Banca Examinadora: Prof. Dr. Donizeti de Andrade (ITA), Presidente e Orientador Paulo Soares Oliveira Filho (EMBRAER), Co-orientador Prof. Dr. Ligia Maria Soto Urbina (ITA), Membro Interno M. Eng. Felipe Alexandre Nascimento Santos (EMBRAER), Membro Externo
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract The introduction of Very Light Jets (VLJ) worldwide in the modern aviation environ- ment represents a potential challenge in terms of safety and investigation. The VLJs are intended to be own by a single pilot and carry a high level of automation, with state of the art glass cockpits and extensive use of onboard software. Although in some cases it is not even mandatory for them to carry a CVR/FDR, some manufacturers choose to provide these recorders for their VLJ in order to improve the safety and investigation resources. The FDR will be more limited than the ones used in commercial aviation, but, nonetheless, will open the possibility for some important safety monitoring programs, like Flight Operations Quality Assurance (FOQA). This study describes modern VLJS and recorder systems, then covers the selection of the parameters for the FDR dataframe of a VLJ and proposes the structure of a FOQA program for this type of aircraft. The aircraft used as a case study is the EMBRAER Phenom 100.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Orientador: Donizeti de Andrade Co-Orientador: Alexandre Juliano Bianchi
Resumo Desde o inэcio das operaчѕes comerciais as aeronaves bimotoras civis sуo limitadas a voar a uma distтncia equivalente a menos de 60 minutos, com um motor inoperante, a partir de um aeroporto. Essa limitaчуo restringiu durante anos a operaчуo de bimotores em rotas importantes da aviaчуo comercial, como a do Atlтntico Norte, entre Estados Unidos e Europa. Com base no desejo de operadores e fabricantes de aeronaves, durante a dщcada de 1980, a autoridade americana, FAA, criou uma permissуo de extensуo dessa distтncia, chamando-a de operaчуo ETOPS. A partir dessa extensуo, o operador poderia voar sua aeronave a distтncias superiores рs correspondentes a 60 minutos, com um motor inoperante, a partir de um aeroporto. Seguindo a autoridade americana as principais autoridades aeronсuticas mundiais iniciaram pesquisas e criaram seus critщrios para tal extensуo e a operaчуo ETOPS tem acontecido, durante mais de 20 anos, atravщs de uma extensуo de regra para todas as autoridades aeronсuticas. Devido a essa particularidade, e com intuito de padronizar a operaчуo, no ano 2000 a FAA criou um grupo de estudos para incluir a operaчуo ETOPS dentro de seus regulamentos (14 CFR), tanto de produto como de operaчуo, permitindo assim que uma aeronave seja opcionalmente capaz de operar ETOPS, dependendo apenas da aprovaчуo do operador. Esse trabalho detalha a nova regra sobre operaчуo ETOPS emitida pela FAA e, ao final, analisa a capacidade da aeronave da EMBRAER, ERJ 190-100, operar segundo a mesma.
Data da Defesa: 5 de junho de 2009
Banca Examinadora Prof. Donizeti de Andrade (ITA) Presidente (Orientador) Eng. Alexandre Juliano Bianchi (EMBRAER) Membro (Co-orientador) Prof. Bento Silva de Mattos (ITA) Membro Interno M.E. Francisco de Melo Vieira Jњnior (EMBRAER) Membro Externo
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract Since the beginning of commercial operation, twin-engine airplanes are limited to flying in a distance equivalent to 60 minutes, with one inoperative engine, from an airport. This limitation restricted for years the twin-engine operation on very important route such as the North Atlantic route, between United States and Europe. Based on requests from operators and aircraft manufacturers during the 1980s, the American aviation authority - FAA - issued an extension allowing the operation beyond the 60-minute rule. This extension was called ETOPS. With this extension the commercial operator of a twin-engine airplane should fly distances higher than the old one correspondent to 60 minutes distance, with one inoperative engine. Following FAA decision, several aviation authorities issued an extension for the 60-minute rule and ETOPS operation has been working as an extension of a regulation for more than 20 years. Because of this particularity, in 2000, FAA created a workgroup to discuss ETOPS operation and include its requirements within the official regulation (14 CFR), involving the parts for product certification and operation, allowing the airplane be optionally certified for ETOPS operation, its operation depending only on the operator certification. This dissertation details the FAA ETOPS rule and, at the end, demonstrate the EMBRAER airplane ERJ 190-100 capability for its operation.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: As Forчas Armadas usualmente equipam seus pilotos de helicѓptero para possibilitar emprego aщreo em qualquer perэodo do dia. Entretanto, os efeitos da fadiga de voo relacionados a operaчѕes noturnas, turnos de trabalho, escalas variсveis, alteraчуo do ritmo biolѓgico e sobrecarga de atividades sуo passэveis de restringir a atividade aщrea, uma vez que podem reduzir o desempenho, o alerta e a seguranчa das tripulaчѕes. Com objetivo principal de identificar as estratщgias utilizadas para minimizar a fadiga, de acordo com a percepчуo dos militares que realizam voos de helicѓptero, um questionсrio foi direcionado a trъs unidades aщreas das Forчas Armadas Brasileiras como instrumento de coleta de dados. Para este fim, considerando a facilidade de acesso, foram escolhidas duas organizaчѕes do Exщrcito Brasileiro (2К Batalhуo de Aviaчуo do Exщrcito e Centro de Instruчуo de Aviaчуo do Exщrcito) e uma da Forчa Aщrea Brasileira (5К Esquadrуo do 8К Grupo de Aviaчуo), as quais possuem a formaчуo bсsica de voo com ѓculos de visуo noturna (OVN) como critщrio de inclusуo. A importтncia na participaчуo desses militares deve-se р constтncia de voos noturnos associada aos fatores complicadores do emprego tсtico de helicѓptero, aumentando a possibilidade de vivenciar situaчѕes susceptэveis р formaчуo de fadiga. A anсlise e interpretaчуo dos dados obtidos no questionсrio possibilitaram confrontar analogamente a percepчуo dos membros das unidades aщreas com estudos teѓricos e cientэficos voltados ao tema da pesquisa. Os resultados apontam que: a educaчуo da fadiga щ realizada nas reuniѕes periѓdicas da unidade aщrea, quando o assunto щ proposto, mas com indэcios limitados da participaчуo de especialistas ou de emprego de dados cientэficos; o acompanhamento dos limites de horas de voo щ gerenciado principalmente pelo setor de operaчѕes, responsсvel pela escala das atividades aщreas; e o monitoramento da jornada de trabalho щ resultado de um consenso entre os chefes e subordinad
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract The Armed Forces usually equip their helicopter pilots to allow air employment at any time of day. However, the effects of fatigue related to night operations, shift work, irregular schedules, circadian rhythms disorders and work overload are likely to restrict flights since they can reduce crew performance, alertness and safety. Aiming to identify the strategies used to minimize fatigue, according to the perception of the military who perform helicopter flights, a questionnaire was directed at three air units of the Brazilian Armed Forces as an instrument of data collection. To this end, considering the facility of access, there were chosen two organizations of the Brazilian Army (2nd Battalion of the Army Aviation and Army Aviation Training Command Center) and one of Brazilian Air Force (5th Squadron of 8th Aviation Group), which have the basic training flight with night vision goggles (NVG) as a criterion for inclusion. The focus on participation of these military due to the constancy of night flights associated with the tactical helicopter complicating factors, increasing the chance to experience situations susceptible to fatigue. The analysis and interpretation of the data obtained in the questionnaire allowed cross-checking with the perception of members of the air units with theoretical and scientific studies dealing with the topic of research. The results show that: the education of fatigue is held at the regular meetings at the air unit, when it is offered, but with limited evidence of the participation of experts or use of scientific data; monitoring flight time limits are managed primarily by the air unit operations sector, responsible for the flight schedules; and monitoring duty time results from a consensus among managers and subordinates, or from observation of the immediate supervisors or commanders. Apparently, the reporting and communication systems are poorly explored in terms of fatigue, whose symptoms indicated as the most noticeable a

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: O sucesso de uma empresa fabricante de aeronaves estс intrinsecamente ligado р estratщgia corporativa seguida pela mesma, e nуo somente рs caracterэsticas do produto, pois o mercado de aviaчуo possui altos riscos envolvidos. Щ importante salientar que essas estratщgias podem, em cenсrios adversos inesperados, gerar resultados negativos. Portanto, quanto melhor for a avaliaчуo dos fatores envolvidos, menos suscetэvel estarс a empresa. Щ nessa conjuntura que a Embraer determinou como uma possэvel estratщgia a instalaчуo de uma unidade fabril em Melbourne, nos Estados Unidos. Com isso a empresa, entre outros fatores, reduz os riscos de tornar-se alvo de polэticas protecionistas, podendo atщ mesmo beneficiar-se destas polэticas. Contudo, qualquer estratщgia empresarial no mundo da aviaчуo deve ser analisada dentro do escopo da certificaчуo aeronсutica. Assim, o presente trabalho apresenta um estudo de caso em que щ considerado, sob a perspectiva de certificaчуo da unidade fabril, qual autoridade primсria de certificaчуo civil, a Agъncia Nacional de Aviaчуo Civil (ANAC) ou a Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), adequar-se-ia melhor aos objetivos estratщgicos da empresa. Portanto, um estudo dos cenсrios щ realizada, atravщs da metodologia SWOT, onde a anсlise das polэticas, acordos e regras das autoridades do paэs de origem e do paэs de implantaчуo da fсbrica sуo consideradas de maneira a obter um panorama comparativo destes ambientes, de forma a validar ou nуo a decisуo da empresa. Apѓs as anсlises e consideraчѕes supracitadas, a certificaчуo da unidade de Melbourne atravщs da FAA foi definida como a mais adequada aos objetivos da Embraer, ratificando a posiчуo da empresa.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: The success of an aircraft manufacturer is intrinsically linked to the strategy it follows, instead of depending only upon the characteristics of the product, since the aviation market, although promising, has high risks involved. It is important to emphasize that these strategies may, in unexpected adverse scenarios, generate negative results. Therefore, the better the assessment of factors involved, the less vulnerable to the company it will be. It is in this context that Embraer has determined as a possible strategy the installation of a plant in Melbourne, United States. Thus, the company, among other factors, reduces the risk of becoming the target of protectionist policies, though it can come to benefit from these policies. However, any business strategy in the world of aviation must be considered within the scope of aircraft certification. This paper presents a case study where is considered, from the perspective of certification of the factory, which primary authority for civil certification, the Agъncia Nacional de Aviaчуo Civil (ANAC) or the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), would better fit the corporate strategic goals. A study of scenarios is accomplished through the SWOT methodology, where the analysis of policies, agreements and rules of the country of origin and country of installation of the factory are considered in order to produce a comparative analysis of these environments, to validate or not the decision of the company. After the analysis and considerations above are conducted, one come to the condition that the certification of the Melbourne plant through the FAA is the most appropriate for achieving the goals of Embraer, confirming the decision made by the company.
